Игре 7 лет, а поиграл только сейчас. Ну что могу сказать: шедевр. Игра очень захватывает своей атмосферой и в нее хочется играть и играть. Жаль, что уровней мало, но сюжет потрясный. 
Приступаю ко второй части.

Davvero bello, è uno di quei giochi che ti restano impressi nella mente per tutta la vita. Consiglio di aspettare qualche offerta e di prenderlo insieme al sequel, Portal 2. Unico difetto è la longevità, dato che personalmente l'ho finito in circa 3 ore e mezzo.

Um bom jogo, com boas físicas e que faz você pensar muito para resolver os desafios, mas não é estressante, um jogo extremamente divertido e inteligente!

A short game, definitely, but it's well-developed, and the shortness of the game makes you want to play it again and again. Portal introduces a unique concept to platforming, and it's no surprise that the game is regarded highly by the gaming community as a classic.
It's absolutely worth playing, if you haven't yet. If you have, play it again.

Portal is one of the most fun games I have played in a long time. It is a combination of first person camera view with an almost pure puzzle solving game style which is an awesome combination  This game gives you the basic training on how to use the portal gun and to find the introduction of GLaDOS's true colours, or rather AI glitches that makes any threat to human kind.   Great voice acting from Glados and she is what makes the game so great, you hear her throughout the game and her dialog is really funny. Sounds like HAL from Space Odysee. The robots have such cute voices.
This is a fascinating puzzle game that i got with the Orange Box, a bundle of random Valve games like Half Life and Team Fortress 2. And guess what, the events of Portal take place within the Half Life universe, something that makes this game much more cooler. Portal is extremely short. It will take only a few hours to complete the whole game but the minimal time you will spend with the game, is well-worth the money. And the advantage to this, YOU CAN PLAY PORTAL 2 !  Great game. The mechanic of transportation through teleporting is the best! Wish it existed in real life so that i can get to places much easier and faster.  Wow. But Why are you reading these reviews when it's clear that this is one amazing game that everyone should own? Instabuy NOW!   

And if you liked portal, you may also want to try out this other similar game called QUBE
Loved this game. Second one is just as good. Got a little dizzy playing.

Very short game, but absolutely amazing. You try to survive several test while being monitored by a psychopath robot who makes sarcastic comments every now and then. Whats not to like?

Do I recommend this game? It really all comes down to the price when you get it. I was lucky and got it for less than $5 during a sale, and it was well worth the price.

This game is challenging, frustrating, and fluid In a way that makes you want to come back for more. For a fairly old game It is just great. The only downside is the lack of storytime. I was able to beat it in less than 5 hours, start to finish.

I DO believe there are DLC's on this game, which would make up for the lack of time (as long as the DLC's came at a fair price), but the game by Itself can be beat in one sitting.

I do recommend this game If you catch it for a good price and have some cash lying around, but I honestly wouldn't spend more than $10 on it.

Last Played: May 2014
PROS: + GLADOS is actually really funny + Looks good, even after 6 years
CONS: - Really short and really easy - Neither revolutionary nor evolutionary
REVIEW: If we are being honest, Portal is not a puzzle game, despite many claims to the contrary. It is a "puzzle-ish" game for people who like shooters. I liked that it was difficult to die, since it made it easier to focus on finding solutions to the "puzzles", but even with easy deaths the hard part about this game isn't figuring out what to do, it is doing it with somewhat fiddly controls (played using an XBOX 360 controller). Still, if the game disappoints on puzzle satisfaction, it really delivers on dry humor. Your handler, GLADOS is very funny and when she sings the credits song you can't help but grin. The graphics are still shiny (some texture mapping looks bad, but doesn't detract too badly) even after 6 years, which is no small feat as games start to age. As others have said, the level of difficulty will probably see you finishing the base game in less than 3 hours, even if you get stuck-a disadvantage since it significantly boosts your $ cost per hour of entertainment. This also hurts a decision to buy because Portal introduced no really new elements to physics puzzlers nor did it do them especially better, it seems to owe its current popularity to previously high reviews (much like Angry Birds).

Still, one of the best measures of a game is whether you'll remember it after you're done, and I have to say I will remember Portal. Just don't spend more than $5 on it.
Amazing and classic game. Everyone should play this at some point!
Fun game

I'm not normally a person who gives out 10/10 reviews to any game or mod as I am a relatively hard person to please, but some titles deserve nothing more!

Portal is a game series that I avoided like the plague when it was first announced by Valve, for no other reason than for the fact that it was popular and had nothing to do with the Half-Life series (or so I thought), so I just let is pass me like the wind. Eventually, I came across a sale on Steam that had the Entire Valve package for less than £30.00, which included the Portal Series, so since I had paid for them, I figured I may as well try them and well, I was not disappointed!

I loved the first Portal game, even though it was short, it had everything that I good game should have! Great game-play and a great story, and Portal 2 really improved upon everything that Portal 1 had to offer. There are practically zero faults that I have with this game.

It just goes to show that you should never judge a book by its cover and that just because something is popular, doesn't mean you should automatically dismiss it. The great game-play, storyline and endless fan chambers really do make this game worth paying for. Great job to everybody involved, it takes a lot to please me, but this was no contest!

Innowacyjna gra zręcznościowo logiczna. Początkowo myślałem, że to gra nie dla mnie. Jednak po pierwszych kilku etapach, wciągnąłem się na dobre. Gra zafascynowała mnie swoją fabuła, która jest uboga w szczegóły, których gracz może się domyślać oraz owiana tajemnicami, które odnajdujemy na poszczególnych poziomach.
Generalnie mamy do dyspozycji innowacyjny teleporter, dzięki któremu musimy pokonywać przeszkody, i tyle, nic więcej. Mimo tego gra potrafi sprawić wiele radości i czasem przysporzyć trochę kłopotów. Zdecydowanie polecam.

I like this game because it's unique. It's not a first person shooter like it initially appears to be, it's a first person puzzle game. Don't let the word "puzzle" fool you into getting the idea that this is a typical puzzle game though, it's very action packed. The entire game revolves around the concept that there are blue portals, and orange portals, and that objects and people who pass through one portal appear out the other. You use the portals to navigate the stages, alter the paths of moving objects, and to use momentum to "fling" yourself around the stages. The game is very short, so you could easily play through it in a single run. Those who want more can play the advanced chambers, which are remastered versions of story chambers that have been modified to be more challenging. If that isn't enough, the game has a surprisingly deep story. I recommend this to anyone who wants a quick fix, or a little change from the "shoot 'em up" norm that video games have come to.
